channel.title: Changing the client background
channel.description: I need to know what to look in and what to change to make the background MY background

item.title: Changing the client background
item.dc:creator: @Fluoxetine Fluoxetine
item.description:
@Fluoxetine wrote:

bigbaddrag:

if it’s for the background for when you’re typing your login details and ip and such, just find the image that is currently set as the background, edit it and take note of the size, now you can erase everything and copy/paste your image on, and resize it so that it is the same size for horizontal AND vertical, otherwise the client won’t work right. just save that image, and then open you client to see if it worked.

Dont forget to compile first!

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the client background
item.dc:creator: @bigbaddrag bigbaddrag
item.description:

if it’s for the background for when you’re typing your login details and ip and such, just find the image that is currently set as the background, edit it and take note of the size, now you can erase everything and copy/paste your image on, and resize it so that it is the same size for horizontal AND vertical, otherwise the client won’t work right. just save that image, and then open you client to see if it worked.

item.title: Changing the client background
item.dc:creator: @Joker3 Joker^
item.description:
@Joker3 wrote:

Here i use this one its easy copy and paste to a txt doc then save as .cmd

@echo off @TITLE Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic
